info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued August 31 at 7:09PM MDT until September 02 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR HOT TEMPERATURES, GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND A COLD FRONTAL WIND SHIFT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 113, 115, AND 117... The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a Fire Weather Watch for hot temperatures, gusty winds, low relative humidity, and a cold frontal wind shift, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Hill and Blaine Counties, Chouteau and Fergus Counties and Central and Eastern Lewis and Clark National Forest Areas. * TIMING...Hot, dry, and windy conditions may begin as early as late morning. A cold front will move southeast across the plains between mid-afternoon and late evening. * TEMPERATURES...Around 80. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph becoming Northeast sometime between mid-afternoon and late evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...Any new fire starts could be difficult to contain.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. A combination of gusty winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will create high fire growth potential. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Fire Weather Watch.
